page.title: 07Education in Swindon
page.content: In Swindon we have a small modern primary school.It has the same name as the church,St.John's.Just over a hundred children attend the school.The youngest are nearly five and they are in Mrs Humphrey's class.Mrs.Jones teaches the older infants.When they are juniors they go into Mr.Beaumont's class.Mr.Griffiths,who is the headmaster takes the top class.The children in this class are between 10 and 11.Mrs.Brown teaches some of the time and Mrs.Ryan looks after us if we are poorly.Mrs.Robinson cooks the dinners.Lots of children stay to dinners or sandwiches.Mrs.Butler is the secretary.It is a good school. When children leave this school they go to Edgecliffe High School which is at Kinver.The children travel to Kinver on a coach which is provided by Staffordshire.
